moves.2... Bf5: No k-side development from black as of yet.
moves.3. d3 e6: Connecting pawns opening for the bishop
moves.6. Nf3 Nd7: Maybe black was pressured about the time...
moves.7... Be7: Not good black should be thinking about castling queenside as the k-side is ruined
moves.8. c4: Trying to get rid of the centre pawn.
moves.8... Bf6: Black ignores this and places an attack on the unprotected bishop
moves.9. d4: Rather than retreat or exchange, white chooses to block with the pawn and gain a better position
moves.9... Be4: Of course, moving the pawn also allows e4 to be unprotected
moves.10. cxd5 Bxd5: Clearing away the d pawn's centre control so now white has power on the fourth rank
moves.11. Qd3: Bringing out her majesty and obviously attacking the somewhat pathetic rook
moves.11... Rh8 12. e4: Fighting for centre control and attacking black's bishop
moves.12... Nc5: Trying to retaliate. If dxc5 then ...Bxb2 winning the bishop and rook for a Knight and bishop. Still a mistake because...
moves.13... c6: Mistake again. Now black compromises queenside pawn structure for castling
moves.14. Qxc5 Bxe4: He gets a centre pawn for compensation
moves.15... Bd5 16. Nc4: White is thinking about slowly moving in...
moves.17. Qa5 Qxa5 18. Nxa5 Bb4: He attack the Knight on the rim
moves.20... Be7 21. b4 Rb8: Attacking Knight which can move to covered areas
moves.22... Bxc5 23. dxc5: If bxc5 then rook gets bishop
moves.23... Ke7: Connecting rooks or hoping to get a castled position by force
moves.24. Be5: A nice place for the white bish
moves.25... Kd7 26. Ne5+: Fits like a lock and key
moves.26... Ke8: No way to induce castling now!
moves.27. f3 h5: Black decides to attack the k-side as his position is not really suitable for castling anyway. Position may have been OK if he played well but he was at a disadvantage
moves.28. Rfe1 h4 29. Nd3: White prepares to capture pawn with the bish but loosens the grip around blacks king
moves.29... hxg3 30. Bxg3 Nh5: Attack that was waiting to happen
moves.33. f4 Bxg2: A sad day for Whites lsb who never really got any action from the sidelines...  :'(
moves.34. Rxe6+: Exposed e pawn must be taken care of to reach the black kings lair
moves.34... Kf7 35. Re7+: The dsb has been very useful
moves.35... Kg6 36. Kxg2: Taking back the bishop. Now white is at +4
moves.37. Nxf4+ gxf4: The board is looking more empty now
moves.38. Rg1: The king can move out the way later rather than take the pawn first
moves.39... Rcg8+: Blaxk tries to get in first
moves.41. Re2: Also protection but from h file attack
moves.41... Rh3 42. Ref2: F file attack. Battle of the rooks!
moves.44. Re2+: You can run but you can't hide...
moves.45... Rxb4: Hes getting greedy but its really causing problems for black -now a mate is coming up
moves.46. Rxf6+: Here we go! There was less than 50 seconds left at this stage
